result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor K. Altreuter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Transcript of September 23, 2016, Sentencing after Revocation Hearing held before the Honorable Jennifer L Weston

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry

Case called at 10:41 am [sf]
Defendant Taylor K. Altreuter in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock and Attorney De La Rosa advise that they have received the Revocation Packet.
ADA Shock presents sentence recommendation.
Attorney De La Rosa presents sentencing argument.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court sentences Ms. Altreuter 3 years 1 month, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 13 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 405 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to pay outstanding costs and fees
--to attendTrauma Informed Cognitive Therapy
--DOC must assist the defendant in her effort to locate a qualified professional in trauma informed cognitive therapy

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess:11:12 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 22, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Court orders Conditional Jail time: 106 days county jail without Huber to be released on October 14, 2015 to Department of Corrections staff for Taylor Altreuter to attend 16-18 week Addams ATR Program.
from Probation Agent requesting conditional jail time with proposed Amendment to JOC

--Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed

Sentencing hearing on January 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

On Defense Motion to Adjourn the 12/23/14 Sentencing: 
case called at 11:27am. [MK]
Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock notes that his voicing of objection to the requested adjournment was that the State was hoping to have the sentencing scheduled sooner, however counsel have learned that there is not time available for this.
The Court grants the adjournment request. The Court indicates that it will retain the file through the Judicial Rotation. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that Ms. Altreuter's address remains unchanged.
recess 11:29am.  

NEXT:  reschedule Sentencing Hearing in Branch I (allow 1/2 hour)

Cases 14CF287 & 14CF291 called together at 9:17 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Taylor K. Altreuter in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF287: On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the on or near enhancer on Count #1

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#2 & Case 14CF291

Atty De La Rosa requests matter be set out approx. 60 days for sentencing, presents basis
ADA Teuber: No objection
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Ms. Altreuter
Recess: 9:22 am

cases #14CF287 & #14CF291 called at 11:18am. 
Defendant Taylor K. Altreuter in court with Attorney Jeffrey J. De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Altreuter waives her right to Preliminary Hearings in both cases; the Court accepts these waivers and binds her over for Trials.

Arraignment held in each case :
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Ms. Altreuter verifies that the Jackson Street address remains current. 
recess 11:23am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/24/14 at 10:20am  (2) schedule both cases for Status Conference approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial
Defendant's
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Conflict Review Worksheet
[MK]

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 2:33pm. 
Defendant Taylor K. Altreuter appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel). ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Altreuter verifies that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint, and that the address listed is her mailing address.


Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge in Count #1 and its maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Altreuter. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by the Defense, but not by the State;  the Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the twenty day time limit. 

The Court requires a $2500  signature bond, with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--not to possess needles such as a type used to deliver substances into the body unlesss Ms. Altreuter has a documented medical need for such a needle 
--no contact with Scott Hayes
--not to be present at 271 W. Racine Street in Jefferson

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
recess 2:41pm. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 9/2/14 at 11:00am.   (JA- please note in comments that recitation of the misdemeanor charges and maximum penalties is needed)
